abstract.para: This document reflects a development team’s view of MMORPG Ireon's gameplay.
You can find additional information at project’s forum. Also feel free to e-mail to input@ireon.org.

sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: Ireon is a three-dimensional multiplayer online RPG for the Windows operational system on a PC platform. Game action is going to take place in a fantasy world where players would live in a virtual community.
The project is entirely open-source and free-of-charge for all.

sect2.title: Game concept
sect2.para: Game concept lies in a creation of a virtual world. Players’ occupation in this world is not restricted to fights. The world is developed to satisfy needs of different player categories such as warriors, politicians, traders, crafters, explorers and socializers. Another feature of a world would be accent on a group gameplay. Players would either meet the challenges as a group in one team or in several groups opposing each other. In such kind of a system the role of npc (mobs) is subsidiary: players need them only for some hunting if there is no team available. The most interesting gameplay is provided for groups of players.

We regard the future world as a place where residents can occupy themselves with interesting affairs. Thus gameplay consists of mini-tasks every one of which offers gameplay for certain group of players. Some of the tasks are proposed for fighters (e.g. some quests), another ones are for socializers (talks in a tavern). The biggest and most interesting tasks we call pseudoquests (more about pseudoquests see below). One distinguishing feature of pseudoquests is that they happen by themselves, and player characters just join them. Another one is that in such pseudoquests players oppose other players in teams.

The world of the game would be a fantasy one, but this fact doesn’t suppose the use of any fixed undoubted system or one source. The world is developing first for of all for needs of a gameplay, combining different rpg systems and worlds of different authors, combining realism and fiction.

formalpara.title: World size and saturation
formalpara.para: Game world (Novalia island) would be small but very saturated. We do not promise vast territories: the player would be able to cross the whole island afoot for about half an hour or even less, but the existing space would be filled with content to the maximum. Our approach to world design is providing width of functionality instead of increasing amount of the similar content.

sect2.title: Players
sect2.para: The game is developed for hardcore and moderate players. Enhanced possibilities of players’ interaction and simplicity of use (which is one of the main priorities during the game development) may possibly attract some players from mass sector. The game is designed for the players who are at least 14 years old.

sect2.title: General description of gameplay
sect2.para: Game process consists of management of player’s character and use of this character for carrying-out certain actions, such as

The game will take place in a uniform three-dimensional world (island of Novalia). Therefore there will be no "locations" in the game, the player will be able to move through all accessible world at once.

All of the game actions will happen in a real time and a three-dimensional space. The exception will be made only for certain actions like crafting or things’ exchange that are carried out using special interfaces.

sect3.title: Look and control
sect3.para: There will be first-person and third-person look in the game. The player will be able to switch between the two views. Third-person look will have the sufficient mobility, the player will be able to change the angle of view, a direction and a distance to the character.

The player will operate the character using 'point-and- click' system. Thus operating the mouse player moves the cursor on the screen and decided the place he wants the character to go or a character to attack. Also using cursor player gets access to in-game menus and other interface elements. Keyboard operation of character will also be supported.

sect3.title: Pseudoquests
sect3.para: Based on a principle of mini-games we introduced special term and that is pseudoquests. The most interesting mini-games in the world of Ireon are called pseudoquests. Pseudoquests have two basic qualitites: they are self-sufficient and players who participate in them oppose other players.

formalpara.title: Self-suffiency
formalpara.para: Pseudoquests exist without players. Pseudoquests are generated by system and serve as a lure for players, the task they can solve. Of course, without players pseudoquests are of no interest. But as they work by themselves players are free to join actions performed by AI and get fun and benefit for their characters.

formalpara.title: Players' confrontation
formalpara.para: The majority of the pseudoquests would be designed for two teams of players, and those teams would compete for quest completion. Usually this can be achieved by setting opposite reqirements for quest accomplishment. Players can join pseudoquest by their will and they can choose the side also by their will. Cooperation between the members of one team significantly influences the final result of their actions for quest completion. Thus you may say that cooperation is a key factor while fulfilling pseudoquests.

sect3.title: Freedom of choice for players
sect3.para: We hold the opinion that players should be able to choose gameplay to one’s liking regardless of character’s stats and that players should be able to change their choice while not creating new character. That’s why we do not have usual ‘levels’ for characters and stats binded to them: the possibility of making an action depends on skills of the character. That’s why in the war of states (see below) players take part voluntarily, and there is no race war (player is able to choose his side regardless of his character’s race). Also player would be able to choose freely if he wants to fight or participate in peaceful labor. Anybody will be able to make a career in a labor he likes to take part into.

sect3.title: Cooperation of players
sect3.para: Players’ cooperation plays special role in the game. One would be successful most if he co-operates with others. Single play is an option, but most interesting features of the game are designed for a teamplay.

In the game there will be lots of different interactions between players. But the main difference from analogues is that interactions in game will play useful functional role such as clans (see below).

sect3.title: War of states
sect3.para: The most global and interesting pseudoquest from our point of view would be based on a full-scale war between two states. Thus, all the players are divided into four major groups: two conflicting sides, neutral side, and rogues that are hostile towards everybody. In accordance with principles of freedom of choice all the players may choose the side they want to play for regardless of their stats. Therefore if a player doesn't want to fight there will be a peaceful labor for him.

Global pseudoquest based on magical springs capture is closely tied with war of states. It will give wide gameplay opportunities for its participants. It will be available only for characters with high stats. In this pseudoquest several teams from each of two sides will oppose each other. Players' interaction here will take on special significance. In detail this pseudoquest will be described in Software Requirements Specification.
Most of the game will be related with war though this does not always mean only battles. But each citizen of island would feel impact of war on his own back.

sect3.title: Character development
sect3.para: Distinguishing feature of all players' in-game actions is that for their successful accomplishment players need not only the good in-game skills (i.e. character's stats) but also skills and knowledge of a real man in each specific situation. Unlike other RPGs where everything depends on numbers of stats in our game 'human element' plays significant role.

sect3.title: Military actions
sect3.para: Major part of the military actions would be war between the states. Organization and carrying out of campaigns lies on players' shoulders for the most part. That is the players would organize and participate in raids whenever they want to do it. Game AI would encourage players to organize such campaigns. But, definitely, the most interesting part of warrior gameplay would be springs capture pseudoquest. It will be generated periodically (approximately once a week). It will include various actions to be executed by large numbers of warriors and mages. Battles with mobs would be of secondary importance.

formalpara.title: Murders
formalpara.para: Physical restriction on murder takes place only within city boundaries, all the other territories are theoretically free of such restriction. But in practice there are several in-game mechanisms making unlawful murder undesirable for a murderer. There are pc and npc police, carma and reputation and so on. It should be mentioned that all of this stuff applies only to murders of allies and neutral citizens, while murder of a character from an enemy state is considered a good and useful thing.

sect3.para: Also players would be able to perform actions that are illegal in primary states (such as robberies and murders) in a special city-state Elbra. Elbra is a criminal haven.

sect3.title: Peaceful labor
sect3.para: There would be large bifurcated trade system in game. Players would be able to exchange and trade with npc and other players, organize auctions or simply walk from town to town and offer their goods.

Players would be able to create goods through crafting. This process would not only require from crafter to get "knowledge" within the game (as how to create some sort of thing in game), but also real knowledge of crafting process which is non-linear. Quality, characteristics and price of the thing would depend on the whole course of the crafting process. Experienced crafter would be able to make things that are specially tuned for their owner.

Also player would be able to occupy himself with battle and healing magic, potions production, battles on special arenas with in-game money stakes, quest accomplishment, stealing, search for resources etc. Unique gameplay would exist for each profession, and it's not going to be like "click here, than click there". It would allow players to perform actions though various ways and evince one's keenness of wit.

sect3.title: Politics and a system of management
sect3.para: Another form of character development in the game would be political activities. Players would be provided with large opportunities for self-government. Players would themselves take important decisions, which are going to have real impact on game world. Players would themselves create laws and see to their implementation, they would themselves (with a help of live team of course) organize various events.
At the same time character who's executing government functions would receive wage, experience points and so on. Thus politics becomes alternative way of character development.

sect3.title: Professional associations
sect3.para: In the game there would be professional associations of players called clans, which are going to be organized for executing of certain functions. Such associations would be aimed at exectuion of tasks that players would choose themselves while creating a clan. They would in no circumstances fight with each other.

Clan is the group of the players which has publicly offered some services. Players who need such services, will know precisely the place to come to. Clan is an analogue of a real world service firm. For example, there would be clan of "seekers". Players that need some things but for any reason can't get or find them may turn to such a clan and for a contractual fee charge a clan member with a work of search for those things.

sect2.title: Network opportunities
sect2.para: There will be only a multiplayer mode in game, a single mode is not planned.
Players will be able to establish their own servers on the computers connected to a LAN.

The advanced opportunities will be built-in game for players’ intercourse such as a chat, a message system, thematic bulletin boards, etc. Also the game would have the developed system of services that would help novices to become acquainted with the game and join the gamers' community.

listitem.para: Saturated completely three-dimensional island with no separate locations
Presence of different by means and aims forms of players associations
Full-blown and convenient interface, easiness of familiarizing with the game
First and third person look with a free camera
Main events for players are taking place in massive military campaigns, not minor internal skirmishes or quests
Developed fightning system with a rich set of combos and tricks
Reduced influence of levels on player's actions
Three levels of development in each profession
The game is free-of-charge for players
Anyone can establish his own server

sect1.title: Platform
sect1.para: The game will be developed for the PC platform. Development for other platforms currently is not planned. Developers will support the client for Windows OS, and server for FreeBSD. Developers will not support any other systems, but will help anyone who's willing to do it. Game will be played through the Internet. The virtual allocated server will be rented for the game. The game through the Internet for all users will be free-of-charge.
Hardware requirements for client and server parts will be described later in Software Requirements Specification. Game will need at least 56 Kbit/s internet connecion speed.

sect1.title: Audience
sect1.para: The game is designed for the players who are at least 14 years old. The game is intended for the Russian and English-speaking markets (two game versions in Russian and in English). Also game will be initially developed with the opportunities for further translation in different languages.
